headline: Microsoft Stock Pulls Back, Tries To Hold This Important Moving Average; Is It A Buy Now?
summary: Enterprise software juggernaut Microsoft, like most tech stocks, had started September on the wrong foot.  Microsoft stock reversed bullishly, gaining more than 3% for the month.  On Monday morning, after an enthralling week for equities, Microsoft stock pulled back, falling 0.9% in volume running 15% above usual levels.

raw.headline: Microsoft Stock Pulls Back, Tries To Hold This Important Moving Average; Is It A Buy Now?
raw.summary: Enterprise software juggernaut Microsoft, like most tech stocks, had started September on the wrong foot.  Microsoft stock reversed bullishly, gaining more than 3% for the month.  On Monday morning, after an enthralling week for equities, Microsoft stock pulled back, falling 0.9% in volume running 15% above usual levels.

headline: How a Trump presidency would impact Big Tech
summary: Following Donald Trump's victory in the 2024 US presidential election, tech CEOs were quick to send congratulatory messages. However, Sherwood Senior Correspondent Ronnie Molla suggests this public show of support was more calculated than genuine. "It's like they all prompted ChatGPT for the same response to publicly and then privately talk to Trump," Molla told Catalysts. She notes this was quite different from the tech leaders' reactions to Trump's 2016 win as CEOs now understand from his first presidency that he is capable of "hold[ing] a grudge" or being "very vindictive." Molla singles out Tesla (TSLA) and Elon Musk's related companies, saying they "stand to gain" from Trump's return to the White House due to Musk's deep involvement in the former president's reelection efforts. However, for the broader tech sector, she cautions that the landscape remains "so uncertain" given Trump's potential policies around China tariffs and AI regulation. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: BCP Invests More Than $650M to Modernize its IT Infrastructure with Microsoft and Kyndryl
summary: Banco de Crédito del Perú (BCP) has partnered with Microsoft, a leader in cloud solutions, and Kyndryl, a global leader in IT infrastructure services, to modernize BCP's IT systems with hybrid cloud and help Peruvians gain greater access to digital banking services. This agreement represents BCP's investment of more than $650M over five years, making it one of the largest technology investments in Latin America's financial services sector.

raw.headline: BCP Invests More Than $650M to Modernize its IT Infrastructure with Microsoft and Kyndryl

This agreement represents BCP's investment of more than $650M over five years, making it one of the largest technology investments in Latin America's financial services sector.

headline: Vatican, Microsoft create AI-generated St. Peter's Basilica to allow virtual visits, log damage
summary: The Vatican and Microsoft on Monday unveiled a digital twin of St. Peter’s Basilica that uses artificial intelligence to explore one of the world’s most important monument’s while helping the Holy See manage visitor flows and identify conservation problems.  “It is literally one of the most technologically advanced and sophisticated projects of its kind that has ever been pursued,” Microsoft's president Brad Smith told a Vatican press conference.
